articles.author: Weizhen Tan
articles.title: How Russia could try to get around the European Union's oil sanctions - CNBC
articles.description: EU leaders on Monday agreed to ban 90% of Russian crude by the end of the year as part of the bloc's sixth sanctions package on Russia since it invaded Ukraine.
articles.content:
The EU's partial embargo covers Russian oil brought into the bloc by sea, with an exemption carved out for imports delivered by pipeline following opposition from Hungary.

articles.author: Irina Ivanova
articles.title: EU's Russia oil ban may hurt consumers more than Putin - CBS News
articles.description: Even those who cheer Europe's embargo on Russian energy predict short-term price shocks for nations and consumers.
articles.content: The European Union is moving to wean itself off Russian energy, declaring on Tuesday that it would drop most of the oil it imports from Russia over its attack on Ukraine. The goal is to hurt Russia i… [+4518 chars]
